Title: R: Arbitrary Code Execution
Synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in R, which can lead to arbitrary code execution.

Background.Text: R is a language and environment for statistical computing and graphics.

Description.Text: Deserialization of untrusted data can occur in the R statistical programming language, enabling a maliciously crafted RDS (R Data Serialization) formatted file or R package to run arbitrary code on an end userâ€™s system when interacted with.

Impact.Text: Arbitrary code may be run when deserializing untrusted data.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All R users should upgrade to the latest version:
